Article Title: Who is Natalie Reynolds? Here's everything about the viral Kick streamer who was seen crying outside the TikTok HQ
Article Text:
Image via Youtube/@Nataliereynoldss

Who Is Natalie Reynolds?

More than 5.5 million YouTube subscribers

Around 133K Instagram followers

More than 33K followers on Kick, where she now streams regularly

Natalie Reynolds’ Emotional Meltdown Outside TikTok HQ

Why Was Natalie Reynolds Crying Outside TikTok Headquarters in Viral Video?

Why Caused the TikTok Ban?

The Lake Incident That Sparked Backlash

What’s Next for Natalie?





A video of content creator Natalie Reynolds breaking down outside the TikTok headquarters has gone viral, and the internet has a lot to say. But who exactly is Natalie Reynolds? Why was she crying? And what led up to this dramatic moment? Here’s everything you need to know about the 26-year-old streamer making headlines again.Natalie Reynolds is a 26-year-old social media influencer based in Los Angeles. She first gained traction on TikTok in 2022 with lip-sync and dance videos. Over time, her content evolved into prank skits, relationship-based comedy, and risqué banter with her boyfriend, Zack (real name: Zachary Huelsman). The duo’s playful videos made them regulars on the “For You” page.Beyond TikTok, Natalie has built a strong online presence. She has:On June 9, a video surfaced on X (formerly Twitter) showing Natalie outside TikTok's headquarters in tears. She was seen anxiously speaking on the phone, pleading to be let inside. The reason? Her TikTok account had been banned, and she was reportedly trying to get it reinstated. Her emotional breakdown struck a chord online, with users debating whether it was genuine distress or a publicity move.As of now, the exact reason behind Natalie’s TikTok ban remains unclear. Neither TikTok nor Natalie has officially commented on the matter.However, speculation online suggests the ban may be linked to a controversial prank that backfired in a big way.In May, Natalie faced intense criticism after a prank video showed her convincing a homeless woman to jump into Lady Bird Lake in Austin, Texas, for just $20. The woman allegedly didn’t know how to swim.Natalie reportedly reassured her it was part of a “scavenger hunt” and promised to jump in after her. But when the woman entered the water, Natalie backed out and walked away.The woman was heard shouting that she couldn’t swim, only float. A firetruck was later seen arriving at the scene, presumably to help. Natalie and her group had already left by then.Many viewers were outraged, calling for legal action. Despite the uproar, Natalie shrugged off the backlash and showed no sign of remorse in her follow-up content.Despite the TikTok ban and public backlash, Natalie continues to post content on her other platforms. She remains active on Kick, where she hosts livestreams and talks about her life. She’s also still posting on Instagram and YouTube.However, her recent controversies are raising questions about influencer accountability—and whether platforms should step in when lines are crossed.Natalie Reynolds went viral for all the wrong reasons this time. From prank-gone-wrong to a breakdown at TikTok HQ, her journey is a reminder of how fast things can turn on the internet. Whether she makes a comeback or fades into digital infamy, one thing’s certain: the internet is watching.
Article Summary: Natalie reynolds is a 26-year-old social media influencer based in los angeles. She first gained traction on tiktok in 2022 with lip-sync and dance videos. In may, natalie faced intense criticism after a prank video showed her convincing a homeless woman to jump into lady bird lake in austin, texas.

Article Title: Who is SinCity-MannyWise? The YouTuber who allegedly shot streamer Finny Da Legend in Las Vegas (VIDEO)
Article Text:
(Image via YouTube)

Who is SinCity-MannyWise?

What Allegedly Happened?

What We Know So Far

“Live Fremont Street Experience #Vegas Finny is Winning Here we Go.”

The planned shooting of Finny Da Legend by Manny Wise | Youtuber Shot Dead

A Disturbing Trend?





In a shocking turn of events, YouTuber SinCity-MannyWise has found himself at the center of an alleged shooting incident in Las Vegas. The June 8, 2025, confrontation caught on livestream has rocked the internet, leaving many wondering who SinCity-MannyWise is, what led to this moment, and what comes next. So, here’s everything you need to know!SinCity-MannyWise, known for his bold, Vegas-centric content, has been a familiar name in certain corners of YouTube. Often streaming from the Strip, casinos, and high-energy local events, MannyWise built a brand around unfiltered, sometimes confrontational videos. Despite a relatively short time on the platform, MannyWise built a cult-like following by streaming confrontational content and calling out other streamers.On Sunday night, June 8, viewers tuned in to what they assumed would be another loud and unpredictable Vegas stream. Instead, the live broadcast reportedly ended in gunfire.According to viral clips now circulating online, a man resembling SinCity-MannyWise was seen arguing with another couple outside the Bellagio Hotel and Casino. Moments later, the man allegedly pulled out a handgun and fired multiple shots at them.The victims are believed to be Finny Da Legend and his wife, Bubbly, both prominent figures in the local content scene. Witnesses and the now-deleted video allegedly show the woman screaming in shock before the stream abruptly cuts out.While exact motives are still unclear, the two YouTubers had reportedly been involved in an ongoing digital rivalry. Viewers say the tension had been simmering online for weeks, with verbal jabs, heated livestreams, and online callouts. But no one expected the feud to spill over into the streets of Las Vegas.The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department has acknowledged the incident but hasn’t officially released names. However, social media and fan speculation point to Finny Da Legend and Bubbly as the victims, both reportedly confirmed dead after the attack.The clip that captured the encounter has since been deleted from YouTube, but it continues to circulate on other platforms like X (formerly Twitter). In the aftermath, SinCity-MannyWise’s channel was terminated for violating YouTube's community guidelines. Meanwhile, Finny Da Legend’s channel remains online, with the final listed stream titledThis isn't the first time violence has intersected with livestreaming culture. In recent months, several creators have faced robbery, threats, or worse during live content. But this incident, if confirmed as a double homicide, marks a disturbing escalation.As for SinCity-MannyWise, his digital presence has vanished, but his alleged actions may echo far beyond the internet, possibly into a courtroom. This is a developing story. Stay tuned for further updates as more facts come to light.
Article Summary: Youtuber sincity-mannywise is at the center of an alleged shooting incident in las vegas. The june 8, 2025, confrontation caught on livestream has rocked the internet. The victims are believed to be finny da legend and his wife, bubbly, both prominent figures in the local content scene.

Article Title: “Her emotions were heightened”: Taylor Swift leans on Travis Kelce as she publicly distances herself from Blake Lively–Justin Baldoni legal drama
Article Text:
Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce were spotted in Florida recently. (Image via Ed Zurga/AP Images)

Travis Kelce has been with Taylor Swift as she dealt with the Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni legal drama



Poll Would you like to see more public appearances from Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce? Yes, I love seeing them together! No, they should keep it private

Is Taylor Swift still friends with Blake Lively?





Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce were recently spotted attending a wedding of the NFL star’s cousin as the power couple looked deeply in love with one another. A few days ago, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce were also spotted in Palm Beach, California as they walked hand in hand. While Taylor Swift looked excited and happy, her name is still attached to the infamous Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni’s high profile legal drama, even though she is not subpoenaed anymore. Neither Taylor Swift nor Travis Kelce spoke about the legal drama publicly, it seems like the NFL star has been with the pop star through this.Recently, as per Us Weekly, a source has revealed that “[Swift’s] emotions were heightened when [Baldoni’s] lawsuit was filed, while a second source added, "and [Kelce] was definitely her sounding board.”As per Us Weekly, the source has also added that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce prefer to live in Florida rather than New York City due to the privacy they get.The source said, “They are making fewer public appearances together because [their relationship] brings too much unwanted attention…but there isn’t trouble in paradise.”Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce had chosen to completely stop making any joint appearances after the drama that unfolded in Super Bowl LIX.The billionaire pop star’s name was already attached to the Blake Lively-Justin Baldoni drama which made things just worse for her.But it seems like in the last few weeks, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have decided to make more public appearances together despite the ongoing Blake Lively drama.As for Taylor Swift’s situation with her former best friend, the It Ends With Us star, Blake Lively, the two have completely avoided each other in public.Taylor Swift and Blake Lively used to be frequently spotted together but it seems like their friendship came to a standstill ever since Justin Baldoni sued his It Ends With Us co-star and the lawsuit found the pop star’s name in it.However, Taylor Swift has completely avoided addressing this topic in public even when she was spotted at the 67th Annual Grammy Awards back in February. Since then, Taylor Swift has not made any appearances on the red carpet and is enjoying a peaceful life with Travis Kelce away from the media and spotlight as she deals with her emotions and feelings. While there are rumours of the two getting engaged soon, nothing has been confirmed yet.Also Read: "Been a stressful few weeks for her": Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship might be strained as she finds comfort in Travis Kelce
Article Summary: Travis kelce has been with taylor swift as she dealt with the blake lively-justin baldoni legal drama. Taylor swift and travis kelce were recently spotted attending a wedding of the nfl star’s cousin. A few days ago, the power couple were also spotted in palm beach, california.

Article Title: Who is Aaron Rodgers' girlfriend? Inside the veteran quarterback’s low-key relationship with Brittani
Article Text:
Aaron Rodgers goes public with Brittani and calls the relationship “serious” (Getty Images)

Aaron Rodgers goes public with Brittani and calls the relationship “serious”

Brittani prefers privacy and stays away from the spotlight





Aaron Rodgers is embracing a quieter, more grounded kind of love with someone who’s far from the celebrity spotlight. The NFL quarterback, known as much for his headline-making relationships as his record-breaking career, confirmed in December 2024 that he’s dating a woman named Brittani. Since then, he’s offered rare but telling glimpses into their evolving relationship—revealing it’s not only “serious,” but also different from his past romances in meaningful ways.Aaron Rodgers casually introduced Brittani to the public during an appearance on The Pat McAfee Show, where he mentioned her while talking about his Christmas shopping. "There was one package left for my girlfriend Brittani that hadn’t showed up yet,” he shared. “I was waiting on this to show up, it showed up today.” That low-key reveal may have seemed small, but for Rodgers—who’s often tight-lipped about his love life—it was a notable moment.A few months later, during the same show in April 2025, he shared a more intimate update. “I'm in a different phase of my life. I'm 41 years old, I'm in a serious relationship. I have off-the-field stuff going on that requires my attention," Rodgers said, signaling a deeper shift in his personal priorities.Unlike many of Aaron Rodgers’ former partners—including actresses Shailene Woodley and Olivia Munn—Brittani is not a public figure. She doesn’t use social media, doesn’t follow NFL media coverage closely, and seems happy to remain out of the limelight. Rodgers even joked during the McAfee show that she probably isn’t watching, though he added she might be a fan of the host.Rodgers has been open in recent years about his mental health journey, crediting practices like plant medicine with helping him build deeper emotional connections. On the Aubrey Marcus Podcast, he explained how self-love changed his ability to love others: “It’s only in that unconditional self-love, that then I’m able to truly be able to unconditionally love others.”Previously engaged to Shailene Woodley and romantically linked to other high-profile women, Rodgers now appears to be seeking—and finding—something more grounded. As he put it himself, “It’s a good feeling boys. It is.”Also Read: Cam Newton rips Saints’ quarterback strategy, urges the team to chase Aaron Rodgers in bold Super Bowl push With Brittani, the football icon seems ready to build something far away from cameras, red carpets, and public scrutiny.
Article Summary: Aaron rodgers confirmed in december 2024 that he’s dating a woman named brittani. Brittani prefers privacy and stays away from the spotlight. The nfl quarterback is embracing a quieter, more grounded kind of love with someone who's far from the celebrity spotlight.

Article Title: Ex-Google MD recalls giving Sundar Pichai unsolicited advice on Chromebooks: ‘He knew way more than I did’; calls him a great listener
Article Text: Parminder Singh, a former Managing Director at Google (Google Display, APAC) and Twitter, shared a light-hearted yet insightful anecdote on X about a chance encounter with Sundar Pichai years before he rose to become Google’s CEO.Singh recalled attending a Google office party in Mountain View where he was introduced to “an unassuming person who led the Chrome project.” Mistaking the humility for lack of knowledge, Singh said he began offering advice on Chrome notebooks, assuming shared tech expertise.“He listened patiently to my modest suggestions, even asking follow-up questions,” Singh wrote. “It soon became clear that he knew far more than I did — he was simply being gracious.”A few years later, Singh was surprised to learn that the man he had casually advised was none other than Sundar Pichai, newly announced as Google’s CEO. “That’s the thing about good leaders — they are great listeners,” Singh added.Reflecting on the moment years later, Singh said he recently listened to Pichai's two-hour interview with podcaster Lex Fridman, joking, “Balance restored, I guess!”When a user asked what advice he had given, Singh said he couldn’t recall much but believed he suggested making Chrome notebooks “more fun/playful” for school children and improving language translation tools for native speakers.Clarifying some confusion caused by the post, Singh added humorously, “It was a Google ‘office’ party — Google party is not a new app (since someone asked!).”
Article Summary: Parminder singh, a former managing director at google (google display, apac) and twitter, shared a light-hearted yet insightful anecdote on x. He recalled attending a google office party in mountain view where he was introduced to “an unassuming person who led the chrome project.”

Article Title: Saudi Arabia resumes Umrah visa issuance from June 10: What pilgrims need to know
Article Text: Saudi Arabia will resume issuing Umrah visas starting June 10, 2025, welcoming international pilgrims from June 11. This follows a successful Hajj season that hosted over 1.6 million pilgrims. The Ministry of Hajj and Umrah instructed Umrah companies to finalize service agreements by May 27 to ensure coordinated pilgrim services.
Article Summary: Saudi arabia will resume issuing umrah visas starting june 10, 2025. This follows a successful hajj season that hosted over 1.6 million pilgrims. The ministry of hajj and umrah instructed umrah companies to finalize service agreements by may 27.

Article Title: ChatGPT global outage continues: Users report facing issues with OpenAI's AI chatbot after 10 hours, what the company has to say
Article Text: ChatGPT, the popular AI chatbot by OpenAI, faced a major global disruption. Users across India, the US, and the UK reported issues with the web, app, login, and APIs. OpenAI acknowledged the problem, citing elevated error rates and latency. Services like APIs, ChatGPT, and Sora were affected. The company is investigating the cause of the degraded performance.
Article Summary: Chatgpt, the popular ai chatbot by openai, faced a major global disruption. Users across india, the us, and the uk reported issues with the web, app, login, and apis. Openai acknowledged the problem, citing elevated error rates and latency.

Article Title: Elon Musk’s Starlink internet plans may start at Rs 3,000: Report
Article Text: Starlink is planning to introduce unlimited internet data plans in India, potentially starting at Rs 3,000 per month, along with a one-time receiver fee. Following a key license acquisition, the company awaits further clearances, including spectrum allocation and infrastructure development, to commence full operations while adhering to stringent national security regulations.
Article Summary: Starlink is planning to introduce unlimited internet data plans in india, potentially starting at rs 3,000 per month. The company awaits further clearances, including spectrum allocation and infrastructure development, to commence full operations while adhering to stringent national security regulations.

Article Title: Shark Tank star Kevin O'Leary blasts 4-day week, says: We should let the French go to two-day workweek and then kick …
Article Text:
Kevin O'Leary

Digital economy has eliminated traditional boundaries

Companies report positive results from flexible schedules

Shark Tank judge and millionaire Kevin O'Leary has dismissed the growing four-day workweek movement as "the stupidest idea I have ever heard," arguing that the modern digital economy has already made traditional work schedules obsolete.Speaking on Fox News, the 70-year-old investor took particular aim at France's exploration of shortened work weeks, suggesting a provocative alternative: "I think we should let the French go to a two-day workweek and then kick their ass internationally," he spoke at a Fox TV show.O'Leary contends that pandemic-era changes have fundamentally altered how work functions. "There's no such thing as a workweek anymore anyway on a digital economy, post-pandemic," he explained. With 40% of his staff working remotely worldwide, he focuses on project completion rather than hours clocked."I don't care when my staff does their work—as long as it gets done on time," O'Leary said, acknowledging that while he opposes mandated four-day weeks, the traditional 9-to-5 model is equally outdated.Despite O'Leary's skepticism, numerous organizations are seeing benefits from shortened workweeks. Performance coaching company Exos implemented a four-day schedule for its 3,500 employees, resulting in 24% increased productivity and halved burnout rates.The trend has gained executive attention, with 30% of CEOs now considering organization-wide schedule shifts, according to KPMG survey data. International governments are also experimenting—Tokyo's metropolitan government recently introduced four-day options to address population decline and improve work-life balance ."We must build a society where everyone can balance work and family life, and one step forward is the four-day workweek," Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike told Fortune.Research supports worker interest, with 77% of employees saying a four-day workweek would favorably impact their wellbeing, even if maintaining 40 total hours, according to Gallup polling.
Article Summary: Kevin o'leary: "there's no such thing as a workweek anymore anyway on a digital economy, post-pandemic" 30% of ceos now considering organization-wide schedule shifts, according to kpmg survey. Tokyo's government recently introduced four-day options to address population decline.

Article Title: GTA 6 new leak reveals expanded gameplay, upgraded map and new features
Article Text:
Image via Rockstar

GTA 6: Key gameplay leaks



GTA 6: Upgraded map



GTA 6: More speculated features



While Rockstar Games maintains a tight lid on information surrounding the highly anticipated Grand Theft Auto 6, a new wave of unofficial "leaks" has reportedly surfaced online, offering more details about the game's gameplay mechanics, expansive map, and various content elements. The leaks suggest that GTA 6 will feature over 700 enterable stores, functional malls, and a revamped character-switching system. Rockstar Games has confirmed that GTA 6 will launch on May 26, 2026, for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S, though a PC release date remains unannounced.According to reports from various gaming news outlets and social media discussions, these recent leaks suggest several intriguing gameplay additions. Among them is the purported return of a 6-star wanted level, a fan-favourite feature from previous GTA instalments. The "relationship bar," previously hinted at in leaked 2022 clips and said to function akin to the "honour" system in Red Dead Redemption 2, also reportedly still exists.New elements include weight mechanics and explorable underwater areas brimming with treasure and secrets. The leak also claims that the scene from Trailer 2 where Jason buys beer is actual gameplay, hinting at enhanced environmental interaction. The "greet and antagonise" system, seen in Red Dead Redemption 2, is also rumoured to be integrated.A significant detail suggests a revamped character wheel with three options: playing as Solo Jason, Solo Lucia, or a Dual protagonist control mode allowing simultaneous control of both characters for open-world robberies and specific missions.The leaks indicate that GTA 6’s map will not feature a Panhandle, contradicting previous speculation. However, the game will still include a vast open world, with Vice City at its core and additional locations inspired by Florida’s diverse landscapes.While a "Disney World parody" is reportedly not included, fans are dissecting every pixel of the existing trailers and unconfirmed data to piece together the full scope of Vice City and its surrounding areas, including Ambrosia and Port Gellhorn.Further alleged content details include the presence of male strippers, an assertion that the driving mechanics are the "best it's ever been," and gore/dismemberment built upon Red Dead Redemption 2's system. However, some rumoured features from earlier leaks, such as fully nude sex scenes, listening to music outside of a car, prone movement, and dual-wielding weapons, are now claimed to have been cut. The story is reportedly structured into five chapters, similar to Red Dead Redemption 2.
Article Summary: A new wave of unofficial "leaks" has reportedly surfaced online. The leaks offer more details about the game's gameplay mechanics, expansive map, and various content elements. Rockstar games has confirmed that gta 6 will launch on may 26, 2026, for ps5 and xbox series x/s.

Article Title: NYT Strands today: Clues, answers, Spangram for June 09, 2025
Article Text:
NYT Strands June 09 2025 – Hints, answers, Spangram



Today's NYT Strands puzzle theme

The theme for today’s Strands is 'What you see isn’t what you get'

Hints for today’s Strands



Hints

Hint #1: the principal front of a building, that faces on to a street or open space.

Hint #2: the use of materials for concealment, either by making something hard to see, or by disguising them as something else.

NYT Strands June 09, 2025 – Hints, answers, Spangram



Spangram for today



FalseFront

Today's Strands’ answers:



MASK

CLOAK

COVER

FACADE

DISGUISE

CAMOUFLAGE

What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?



Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle



Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.

Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you’ve located it.

Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.

The New York Times published its inaugural crossword puzzle on February 15, 1942, in the Sunday Magazine. Created by Charles Erlenkotter and edited by Margaret Farrar, it was the first major newspaper to feature a crossword puzzle. Over the years, the NYT has introduced several beloved games, including the Mini Crossword in 2014, followed by Spelling Bee, Letter Boxed, and Tiles. In 2022, the NYT launched the wildly popular Wordle, followed by additional games like Connections and Strands.NYT Strands is the latest addition to its puzzle offerings. This engaging daily game presents players with new themes each day, challenging them to uncover all the words on the grid. One of the game’s highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board. With its innovative approach to word puzzles, Strands quickly became a fan favorite, adding to the diverse and exciting puzzle lineup of the New York Times.Having trouble solving today’s NYT Strands puzzle? We’re here to help with some easy hints to fuel your curiosity even more. Plus, we’ve got today’s answer waiting for you – just keep reading.Below, we’ve shared the hints, answers, and Spangram for today’s NYT Strands puzzle. The hints may give away part or all of the Strands, so proceed with caution. Scroll down to continue:is the Spangram for today’s NYT Strands puzzle.Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle’s theme.In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you’ve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.
Article Summary: Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of connections, spelling bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.

Article Title: WWDC 2025 Countdown: iOS 26 rumored features that could redefine your iPhone experience
Article Text:
iOS 26 features

iOS 26 expected features that might steal the spotlight at WWDC 2025



1. A new focus on stability



Why it is important

What you can expect:

Improved background process management

Quick switch and animation response times

Less crashing in initial betas

2. visionOS inspired design revolution



What's changing?

Possible changes include:

Floating menus that never get in the way of on-screen information

Redesigned app icons that pop and move

Unified visual language across iPhone, iPad, and Mac

3. A cleaner, smarter camera app



Why it is required

Expected improvements:

Independent UI menus for photos and videos

Improved access to most-used modes

Glass-like overlay menus from visionOS-inspired designs

4. AI health coach: Your intelligent wellness partner

A personalised fitness revolution

Features to watch out for:

Personalised fitness suggestions

Smarter activity tracking based on history

Enhanced food tracking and nutritional guidance

5. AI-Optimised battery life management

Intelligent energy consumption

What could change:

Adjustable battery settings based on use models

Prioritised power distribution to busy apps

Smart charging cycles to minimize long-term battery wear

6. Public Wi-Fi sharing amongst Apple devices



Seamless portal experience

How it works:

Login to a restricted network once on any device (such as an iPhone)

Other Apple devices such as MacBook, iPad) automatically connect without re-authentication

Improved iCloud Keychain integration for saving Wi-Fi credentials

7. Real-time language translation through AirPods



Apple Intelligence meets accessibility:

What you can expect:

On-the-fly translations during live conversations

Automatic language detection while traveling

Seamless AirPods + iPhone sync for multilingual communication

As everyone’s geared up for Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) 2025, excitement is building among tech geeks, developers, and iPhone users. Packed with promises to be one of the biggest WWDC conferences so far, Apple is expected to introduce the most awaited iOS 26 , the future mobile operating system for iPhones. According to reports by BGR, the keynote is speculated to highlight breakthrough developments that not only improves the user experience but will also be compatible with artificial intelligence, has fluidity between cross-devices, and has a more intelligent design philosophy.Even though Apple has not publicly announced all the features, the leaks and rumors within the industry indicate a bright outlook. With AI-driven health recommendations to live translation through AirPods, iOS 26 will embark on a new path in making the iPhone smarter, smarter, and more personal.Listed below are the rumoured iOS 26 features that could completely transform your iPhone.One of the largest issues with beta software over the past few years has been instability during initial releases. Apple is said to be focusing heavily on foundational performance boosts and more refined beta testing cycles with iOS 26. This translates to fewer bugs, improved resource efficiency, and a cleaner experience across models.iOS 26 is expected to bring a UI redesign inspired by visionOS, the operating system behind Apple's Vision Pro. The new design is speculated to come with translucent features, more simplified menus, and a less prominent interface.Over the years, the Camera app has become a bit troublesome with a lot of toggles and buried options. With iOS 26, Apple can finally simplify this interface, providing a more smooth and distraction-free shooting experience.Fitness and health have been at the heart of Apple's world, but iOS 26 might take it to the next level with the launch of an AI health coach. This would take user information from the Health app and Apple Watch and create personalized fitness and wellness advice.Battery life remains a priority for iPhone users. Apple can solve this with AI-driven battery optimisation, where the operating system learns user habits and optimizes background activity accordingly.Accessing public Wi-Fi, particularly captive networks that demand login screens, can become a chore. iOS 26 might bring a shared login feature that is synced across devices with the same Apple ID.Perhaps the most awaited feature is real-time translation support in AirPods, which would possibly be driven by Apple Intelligence (Apple's own AI suite).From an improved battery life to smarter health tracking and real-time translation, the upcoming iOS 26 features seem aimed at making the iPhone not just a device, but a more intuitive extension of daily life. Stay tuned for Apple’s keynote, where all eyes will be on how many of these speculations actually become reality.
Article Summary: Ios 26 is expected to bring a ui redesign inspired by visionos, the operating system behind apple's vision pro. The new design is speculated to come with translucent features, more simplified menus, and a less prominent interface. With ai-driven health recommendations to live translation through airpods, ios 26 will embark on a new path in making the iphone smarter.

Article Title: Los Angeles protests: Why are Waymo robotaxis being torched? At least five self-driving cars destroyed in riots
Article Text:
(Photo: X)

Waymos caught in the chaos

Not just about immigration

Robotaxis: Vulnerable in unrest

Fire risks and health concerns





Several Waymo self-driving taxis were vandalised and set alight during tense protests in Los Angeles following a wave of immigration raids.While the demonstrations were not specifically aimed at Waymo, the Alphabet-owned robotaxis became targets amid growing anger towards law enforcement, surveillance, and perceived inequality driven by Big Tech.At least five Waymo vehicles, all Jaguar I-PACE electric SUVs, were destroyed during protests over the weekend. Thick plumes of smoke billowed over downtown LA after demonstrators smashed windows, spray-painted anti-ICE slogans, and set the driverless cars on fire. Some protesters reportedly threw electric scooters into the burning shells, while others ripped off car doors or used skateboards and improvised flamethrowers to damage the vehicles.The scenes unfolded on Los Angeles Street between Arcadia and Alameda around 5 pm on Sunday. According to CNN and the Los Angeles Times, the vehicles were found lined up and were soon overwhelmed by a crowd angry over the Trump administration’s decision to send in the National Guard, a move California governor Gavin Newsom opposed.Waymo insists the protests were not directly related to its operations. However, critics argue that the robotaxis represent more than just technology.They say the cars, equipped with dozens of cameras, function as roving surveillance devices and may pose a threat to protester anonymity.“Safety is our highest priority,” Waymo spokesperson Ethan Teicher said in a statement. “We removed vehicles from Downtown Los Angeles and will not be serving that specific area for the time being, out of an abundance of caution and with guidance from LAPD.”A spokesperson told USA Today that the company is still operational across most of Los Angeles but has paused services in certain areas where protests have intensified.Waymo’s driverless vehicles, unlike human-operated taxis, lack the ability to judge and flee dangerous situations. Their programmed behaviour makes them passive targets during public unrest. They do not attempt to evade crowds or protest zones. This vulnerability, combined with their high-tech appearance, has made them stand out.The company’s rapid expansion has also drawn criticism. In January, Waymo said it had completed 1.9 million miles in LA alone. While the cars are popular with many users, some residents feel they were never consulted about having driverless technology tested in their neighbourhoods.The destruction of electric vehicles raised significant safety issues. The Los Angeles Fire Department responded to the blazes, and the LAPD warned that burning lithium-ion batteries release toxic gases, such as hydrogen fluoride, which pose risks to both emergency responders and bystanders.Electric vehicle fires are harder to extinguish. Unlike petrol-fuelled cars, EV batteries do not need oxygen to burn. Firefighters instead have to cool the battery using large volumes of water, often through special nozzles that spray directly beneath the vehicle.
Article Summary: At least five waymo vehicles, all jaguar i-pace electric suvs, were destroyed during protests over the weekend. Protesters smashed windows, spray-painted anti-ice slogans, and set the driverless cars on fire. Some protesters reportedly threw electric scooters into the burning shells, while others ripped off car doors.

Article Title: Bangladesh currency drops Bangabandhu's image, new notes without Sheikh Mujibur Rahman's picture are out
Article Text:
Representative image (Picture credit: IANS)





DHAKA: Ahead of Eid-ul-Adha, Bangladesh central bank on Sunday introduced new currency notes of Taka 1,000, Taka 50 and Taka 20, dropping the image of the country's founding father, Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.The new notes, which will be available in banks in the capital from Monday, will have images of various nationally important establishments and scenic places.The bank's Motijheel office started distributing the new notes on a limited scale from Sunday. The notes will be available at other places later.Last week, Bangladesh Bank governor Ahsan H Mansur had said the newly designed notes will not feature any human portraits but showcase natural landscapes and traditional landmarks.
Article Summary: Bangladesh central bank introduces new currency notes of taka 1,000, taka 50 and taka 20. The new notes will be available in banks in the capital from monday. The bank's motijheel office started distributing the new notes on a limited scale from sunday.

Article Title: UK regulator leads crackdown on 'finfluencers'
Article Text:
Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (fca.org.uk)





LONDON: Market regulators from six countries are cracking down on the illegal promotion of financial products by influencers on social media, UK officials said Friday.Britain's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said the action, which began on Monday, has resulted in three arrests in the UK and the authorisation of criminal proceedings against three individuals.The crackdown is being conducted jointly with regulators from Italy, Canada, Hong Kong, Australia, and the United Arab Emirates.Some 50 "warning letters" have been issued, which will result in more than 650 requests to remove content from social media platforms and more than 50 websites "operated by unauthorised finfluencers", the FCA said.It has also sent seven "cease and desist" letters and invited four so-called finfluencers for interviews.So-called finfluencers, or financial influencers, use their social media audiences to promote investment products, share advice, or offer their opinions on investments.Many act legitimately, but some "tout products or services illegally and without authorisation through online videos and posts, where they use the pretence of a lavish lifestyle, often falsely, to promote success", according to the FCA.These products can be risky, such as cryptocurrencies."Our message to finfluencers is loud and clear," said Steve Smart, joint executive director of enforcement and market oversight at the FCA."They must act responsibly and only promote financial products where they are authorised to do so -- or face the consequences."The announcement came as a group of British MPs said it had sent a letter to Meta, owner of Facebook and Instagram, asking for information on its approach to financial influencers.The letter from parliament's Treasury Committee follows evidence from FCA officials that Meta took up to six weeks to remove harmful content, longer than other platforms."There was an isolated incident in late 2024 which resulted in a delay in actioning a small number of reports from the FCA," Meta said in a statement Friday."This was rectified and all other relevant reports made by the FCA have been promptly processed."
Article Summary: Market regulators from six countries are cracking down on the illegal promotion of financial products by influencers on social media. Britain's financial conduct authority (fca) said the action has resulted in three arrests in the uk and the authorisation of criminal proceedings against three individuals.

In a move that signals openness, opportunity, and long-term vision, Dubai's government is actively hiring skilled expatriates across a spectrum of high-impact roles, offering not just jobs, but careers with purpose, stability, and highly attractive salary packages.While the UAE has traditionally prioritized Emirati talent in public service, this current wave of hiring reflects a strategic recognition: global expertise is vital for sustaining and advancing the emirate’s ambitions in sectors like urban planning, healthcare innovation, digital infrastructure, aviation safety, and cultural preservation.And the numbers are turning heads. Some of the roles now listed on Dubai’s official government jobs portal – dubaicareers.ae – come with monthly salaries as high as Dh40,000, drawing attention from experienced professionals across the globe.All listings are sourced directly from the official Dubai Government job portal (dubaicareers.ae) and are open to applicants of all nationalities.Financial Audit AuthorityNot specifiedThe Financial Audit Authority is seeking an experienced Audit Manager to develop and execute audit plans within the energy and industry sectors. The role involves conducting complex, evidence-based audits and preparing reports to support strategic decisions.Dubai Foundation for Women and ChildrenDh10,001–20,000 ($2,720–5,445)Dubai Foundation for Women and Children is looking for a Resident Case Manager to manage internal client cases, implement organizational policies, and coordinate with housing units and call centers. The role also includes conducting and documenting vocational activities.Dubai Air Navigation ServicesNot specifiedDubai Air Navigation Services is hiring an Air Traffic Controller for tower operations at DXB. The position requires at least 3 years of experience in a major international ATC unit. Responsibilities include providing aerodrome and approach control services to ensure safe and efficient aircraft flow in a high-pressure environment.Dubai HealthNot specifiedDubai Health is looking to hire a Head of Infrastructure Operations. The role entails managing both on-premises and cloud-based IT infrastructure, ensuring security, performance, and regulatory compliance. The candidate will also lead disaster recovery planning and capacity management initiatives.Dubai Air Navigation ServicesDh30,001–40,000 ($8,100–10,880)Dubai Air Navigation Services is seeking a Corporate Excellence Specialist to implement excellence models, manage institutional assessments, and provide training for staff.Dubai Government Media OfficeDh20,001–30,000 ($5,445–8,160)The Dubai Government Media Office is hiring a Senior Editor. Responsibilities include developing bilingual press releases, preparing crisis communications, translating and optimizing content for multiple media formats, and supporting content creation for social media and web platforms.Dubai Foundation for Women and ChildrenLess than Dh10,000/month (less than $2,720/month)February 18, 2025OngoingThis role involves supervising and caring for children, including meal preparation, hygiene, educational activities, medication administration, and performing household tasks.Dubai Air Navigation ServicesNot specifiedThe Strategy and Performance Manager will develop corporate strategies, conduct strategic research and forecasting, design KPIs, manage performance tracking, and lead capacity-building efforts.Dubai CultureNot specifiedDubai Culture is seeking an Officer – Collectibles to explain museum exhibits, manage collection data, coordinate projects, maintain files, and handle correspondence and reports to support daily operations.Dubai CultureNot specifiedFebruary 6, 2025November 3, 2025The Archaeology Specialist will provide technical advice for archaeological projects, develop related policies, document artifacts, build partnerships, lead training programs, and represent Dubai in regional academic events.All applicants must apply through the official Dubai Government portal: dubaicareers.ae
Article Summary: Expats can now apply for dubai government jobs with salaries up to dh40,000 ($10,880) dubai's government is actively hiring skilled expatriates across a spectrum of high-impact roles. The uae has traditionally prioritized emirati talent in public service.

Article Title: iOS 26: When can UAE iPhone users expect Apple's latest update? See full features & specs
Article Text: Apple's iOS 26 update arrives this fall for UAE iPhone 11 and later models, promising a "gorgeous new design" and "Apple Intelligence" features like live translation. A public beta is expected next month, likely around mid-July 2025, allowing users a sneak peek. Advanced AI features are exclusive to iPhone 15 Pro, iPhone 16 models, and M1-equipped iPads/Macs. Older devices like iPhone XR/XS will miss out on iOS 26 but will still receive security updates for iOS 18.
Article Summary: Apple's ios 26 update arrives this fall for iphone 11 and later models. A public beta is expected next month, likely around mid-july 2025. Advanced ai features are exclusive to iphone 15 pro, iphone 16 models, and m1-equipped ipads/macs.

Article Title: Apple unveils software redesign while reeling from AI missteps, tech upheaval and Trump's trade war
Article Text:
Apple CEO Tim Cook gives a presentation during an event on the Apple campus in Cupertino, Calif., Monday, June 9, 2025. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu)





After stumbling out of the starting gate in Big Tech's pivotal race to capitalize on artificial intelligence, Apple tried to regain its footing Monday during an annual developers conference that focused mostly on incremental advances and cosmetic changes in its technology.The presummer rite, which attracted thousands of developers from nearly 60 countries to Apple's Silicon Valley headquarters, subdued compared with the feverish anticipation that surrounded the event in the last two years.Apple highlighted plans for more AI tools designed to simplify people's lives and make its products even more intuitive. It also provided an early glimpse at the biggest redesign of its iPhone software in a decade. In doing so, Apple executives refrained from issuing bold promises of breakthroughs that punctuated recent conferences, prompting CFRA analyst Angelo Zino to deride the event as a "dud" in a research note.More AI, but what about Siri? In 2023, Apple unveiled a mixed-reality headset that has been little more than a niche product, and last year WWDC trumpeted its first major foray into the AI craze with an array of new features highlighted by the promise of a smarter and more versatile version of its virtual assistant, Siri - a goal that has yet to be realized."This work needed more time to reach our high-quality bar," Craig Federighi, Apple's top software executive, said Monday at the outset of the conference. The company didn't provide a precise timetable for when Siri's AI upgrade will be finished but indicated it won't happen until next year at the earliest."The silence surrounding Siri was deafening," said Forrester Research analyst Dipanjan Chatterjee said. "No amount of text corrections or cute emojis can fill the yawning void of an intuitive, interactive AI experience that we know Siri will be capable of when ready. We just don't know when that will happen. The end of the Siri runway is coming up fast, and Apple needs to lift off."Is Apple, with its 'liquid glass,' still a trendsetter? The showcase unfolded amid nagging questions about whether Apple has lost some of the mystique and innovative drive that has made it a tech trendsetter during its nearly 50-year history.Instead of making a big splash as it did with the Vision Pro headset and its AI suite, Apple took a mostly low-key approach that emphasized its effort to spruce up the look of its software with a new design called "Liquid Glass" while also unveiling a new hub for its video games and new features like a "Workout Buddy" to help manage physical fitness.Apple executives promised to make its software more compatible with the increasingly sophisticated computer chips that have been powering its products while also making it easier to toggle between the iPhone, iPad, and Mac "Our product experience has become even more seamless and enjoyable," Apple CEO Tim Cook told the crowd as the 90-minute showcase wrapped up.IDC analyst Francisco Jeronimo said Apple seemed to be largely using Monday's conference to demonstrate the company still has a blueprint for success in AI, even if it's going to take longer to realize the vision that was presented a year ago."This year's event was not about disruptive innovation, but rather careful calibration, platform refinement and developer enablement -positioning itself for future moves rather than unveiling game-changing technologies," Jeronimo said.Apple's next operating system will be iOS 26 Besides redesigning its software. Apple will switch to a method that automakers have used to telegraph their latest car models by linking them to the year after they first arrive at dealerships. That means the next version of the iPhone operating system due out this autumn will be known as iOS 26 instead of iOS 19 - as it would be under the previous naming approach that has been used since the device's 2007 debut.The iOS 26 upgrade is expected to be released in September around the same time Apple traditionally rolls out the next iPhone models.Playing catchup in AI Apple opened the proceedings with a short video clip featuring Federighi speeding around a track in a Formula 1 race car. Although it was meant to promote the June 27 release of the Apple film, "F1" starring Brad Pitt, the segment could also be viewed as an unintentional analogy to the company's attempt to catch up to the rest of the pack in AI technology.While some of the new AI tricks compatible with the latest iPhones began rolling out late last year as part of free software updates, the delays in a souped-up Siri became so glaring that the chastened company stopped promoting it in its marketing campaigns earlier this year.While Apple has been struggling to make AI that meets its standards, the gap separating it from other tech powerhouses is widening. Google keeps packing more AI into its Pixel smartphone lineup while introducing more of the technology into its search engine to dramatically change the way it works. Samsung, Apple's biggest smartphone rival, is also leaning heavily into AI. Meanwhile, ChatGPT recently struck a deal that will bring former Apple design guru Jony Ive into the fold to work on a new device expected to compete against the iPhone.Regulatory and trade challenges Besides grappling with innovation challenges, Apple also faces regulatory threats that could siphon away billions of dollars in revenue that help finance its research and development. A federal judge is currently weighing whether proposed countermeasures to Google's illegal monopoly in search should include a ban on long-running deals worth $20 billion annually to Apple while another federal judge recently banned the company from collecting commissions on in-app transactions processed outside its once-exclusive payment system.On top of all that, Apple has been caught in the crosshairs of President Donald Trump's trade war with China, a key manufacturing hub for the Cupertino, California, company. Cook successfully persuaded Trump to exempt the iPhone from tariffs during the president's first administration, but he has had less success during Trump's second term, which seems more determined to prod Apple to make its products in the U.S.The multidimensional gauntlet facing Apple is spooking investors, causing the company's stock price to plunge by 20% so far this year - a decline that has erased about $750 billion in shareholder wealth. After beginning the year as the most valuable company in the world, Apple now ranks third behind longtime rival Microsoft, another AI leader, and AI chipmaker Nvidia.Apple's shares closed down by more than 1% on Monday - an early indication the company's latest announcements didn't inspire investors.
Article Summary: Apple highlights plans for more ai tools designed to simplify people's lives. Company also provides early glimpse at the biggest redesign of its iphone software in a decade. Apple executives refrained from issuing bold promises of breakthroughs that punctuated recent conferences.

Article Title: Bank fixed deposits lose sheen! Post RBI rate cut, investors pick high-yielding corporate bonds; here’s why
Article Text:
Retail investors seeking enhanced returns from fixed-income portfolios are increasingly gravitating towards corporate bonds. (AI image)

Corporate Bonds: What's On Offer

(Disclaimer: Recommendations and views on the stock market and other asset classes given by experts are their own. These opinions do not represent the views of The Times of India)

Bank fixed deposits lose sheen! Retail investors seeking enhanced returns from fixed-income portfolios are increasingly gravitating towards corporate bonds offering higher yields. This shift has intensified following the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) reduction in repo rates by one percentage point since February, leading to decreased bank fixed deposit rates.These investors are focusing on state-guaranteed securities, NBFC bonds, and small finance and microfinance bonds, which provide superior returns compared to traditional bank deposits.State Bank of India's fixed deposits with 2-3 years tenure offer maximum returns of 6.7%, whilst state-guaranteed bonds from Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala and Andhra Pradesh, with 2-4 years tenure, yield returns between 9-10%.Various retail websites offer these bonds with a minimum investment requirement of ₹10,000. These platforms, known as Online Bond Platform Providers (OBPP), are SEBI-registered entities facilitating electronic bond transactions, according to an ET report.Platforms such as Indiabonds, Bondbazaar, Grip Invest and Wint Wealth are experiencing increased trading activity. One platform reported doubled trading volumes in the current quarter compared to July-September 2024.Another platform witnessed a tenfold increase in new registrations compared to the previous year.Also Read | ITR Filing FY 2024-25: Have you got an Income Tax notice? Don't ignore it! Top types of tax notices & actions required "Direct investments in bonds can typically offer an additional return of 3-5 percentage points over traditional fixed deposits," said Bondbazaar founder Suresh Darak according to the ET report.Several NBFCs and MFI bonds with AA or lower ratings from organisations like Muthoot Capital, MAS Financial, and Edelweiss Financial could potentially deliver returns of 10-12%.Financial advisers suggest creating a diversified portfolio of these bonds instead of concentrating investments in a single bond, whilst favouring shorter durations of 2-3 years."Investors may consider two-, three-year bonds, which balance yield potential with visibility on credit risk and interest rate movements," said Indiabonds.com cofounder Vishal Goenka. He notes that the risk-free curve has steepened at the short to medium end with maturity of 2-3 years, making this segment attractive for those looking for better risk-adjusted returns without committing to long tenures.Also Read | Big cheer! Home loan rates head below 8% - how much will 1% RBI repo rate cut reduce your EMI or tenure? Check calculations "Diversify across issuers, tenures and ratings. Do not invest more than 10% in a single issuer, investing across one to three years helps manage reinvestment and interest rate risk and diversification ensures a risk-adjusted fixed-income portfolio," said Darak of Bondbazaar.Wealth managers recommend that investors monitor the company's financial performance and leadership history when purchasing high-yield bonds, considering their elevated risk levels. They advise limiting exposure by acquiring modest quantities of these bonds.
Article Summary: Retail investors seeking enhanced returns from fixed-income portfolios are increasingly gravitating towards corporate bonds. This shift has intensified following the reserve bank of india's (rbi) reduction in repo rates by one percentage point since february.
